page.title: 10FARM LIVESTOCK AND CROPS.
page.content:
{BEEF PRODUCTION}ALTHOUGH SOME FARMERS BOUGHT IN CATTLE TO FATTEN, THE FARM STUDIED KEPT A HERD OF SUCKLERS. THESE ARE COWS RUN WITH A BEEF BULL WHICH REAR THEIR OWN CALVES. THE MOST COMMON TYPE WAS A HEREFORD FRIESIAN CROSS, BUT OTHER BREEDS KEPT INCLUDED CHAROLAIS AND LIMOUSIN. WITHIN THE SURVEY AREA, INTENSIVELY REARED PIGS WERE RECORDED ONCE, BROILER CHICKENS HOUSED IN DEEP LITTER WERE RECORDED ONCE,BUT NO OTHR LIVESTOCK WERE SEEN.
{FARM CROPS}THE FARM STUDIED GREW 52 ha.OF POTATOES, 62 ha. OF WHEAT, 101 ha.OF BARLEY, 73 ha. OF SUGAR BEET AND 16 ha. OF PEAS. THE OTHER MAJOR CROP GROWN IN THE AREA WAS OIL SEED RAPE. {WINTER WHEAT.}THIS WAS SOWN IN OCTOBER AFTER THE LAND HAD BEEN CULTIVATED USING A FIVE FURROW PLOUGH AND POWER
